Localisation.report_string:
--- Localisation ---
  
More precision is possible than: 'right optic nerve'.  
Namely: bilateral optic nerve (cranial nerve II).
  
More precision is possible than: 'right thoracic spinal cord'.  
Namely: right T2 spinal cord.

Differential diagnosis.report_string:
--- Differential diagnosis ---
Correctly included Multiple sclerosis.

- Agree with also considering: MOG Antibody-Associated Disease, Neuromyelitis Optica Spectrum Disorder (AQP4+), Neurosarcoidosis and Neurosyphilis.

- Other differentials to consider include: Autoimmune Myelitis (Sjogren's Syndrome) and Autoimmune Myelitis (SLE).

This suggested differential is less likely to explain the full clinical picture than those above:
- Compressive right thoracic hemicord lesion (e.g., extramedullary tumor/disc)

ft_diagnoses_raw: Compressive right thoracic hemicord lesion (e.g., extramedullary tumor/disc)
additional_diagnoses: Compressive right thoracic hemicord lesion (e.g., extramedullary tumor/disc)

Investigations.report_string:
--- Investigations ---

- Agree with the suggested MRI including the Orbits and Thoracic Spine and CSF test for Oligoclonal Bands - would potentially inform a diagnosis/details of multiple sclerosis.

To evaluate other differential diagnoses:
- Agree with considering: ANA, serum AQP4 Ab, ENA, serum MOG Ab, serum ACE, syphilis.

ft_proposed_investigations: MRI of brain, orbits, and entire spine with gadolinium
Optical coherence tomography (retinal nerve fibre layer)
CSF oligoclonal bands and IgG index
Urine pregnancy test if relevant to therapy

Management.report_string:
--- Management ---
Steroids: Not appropriate to start treatment immediately.
  
Additional factors not mentioned:

- Steroids potentially inappropriate due to comorbidity Type 2 diabetes mellitus.

- No indication this isn't an exacerbation of an old deficit/pseudorelapse.

DMTs: Appropriate to consider but delay treatment.
  
Correctly identified the following:

- Need confirmation of MS diagnosis.

ft_full_plan_parsed.treatment: Intravenous methylprednisolone 1 g daily for 3–5 days
reasons: Acute optic neuritis/myelitis within 2 weeks
Speeds neurological recovery
No systemic infection or contraindication evident
High-dose corticosteroid use
Prevention of steroid-related gastritis/ulcer
Reduced mobility from myelopathy
Prevent hospital-acquired VTE
Improve mobility and reduce falls risk
Address spasticity and proprioceptive deficit
Reserve for poor response to steroids or strong suspicion of NMOSD/MOGAD
Initiate within 7–14 days if inadequate improvement

ft_full_plan_parsed.treatment: Disease-modifying therapy for MS (e.g., ocrelizumab/natalizumab per JCV status)
reasons: Start only after diagnostic confirmation and risk stratification
Requires discussion of options and monitoring plan
Indicated for AQP4-IgG NMOSD prevention
Begin after antibody confirmation and vaccination review
Only if MRI shows compressive thoracic cord lesion
Surgical indication contingent on imaging

ft_plan.treatment: Intravenous methylprednisolone 1 g daily for 3–5 days
reasons: Acute optic neuritis/myelitis within 2 weeks
